results.name: Numerators of coefficient triangle for expansion of x^(2*n) in terms of Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind T(2*m, x) (A127674).
comment: The denominator triangle is given in A273168.
The expansion is x^(2*n) = Sum_{m=0..n} R(n, m)*Tnx(2*m, x), n >= 0, with the rational triangle R(n, m) = a(n, m)/A273168(n, m).
This is equivalent to the expansion cos(x)^(2n) = Sum_{m=0..n} R(n, m)*cos(2*m*x), n >= 0. Compare this with the even numbered rows of A273496.
See A244420/A244421 for the expansion of x^(2*n+1) in terms of odd-indexed Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind.

The signed rational triangle S(n, m) = R(n, m) * (-1)^m appears in the expansion sin(x)^(2n) = Sum_{m=0..n} S(n, m) * cos(2*m*x), n >= 0. This is equivalent to the identity (1-x^2)^n =  Sum_{m=0..n} S(n, m) * T(2*m, x).
link: Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
formula: a(n, m) = numerator(R(n, m)), n >= 0, m = 1, ..., n, with the rationals R(n, m) given by R(n, 0) = (1/2^(2*n-1))*binomial(2*n,n)/2 and R(n ,m) = (1/2^(2*n-1))*binomial(2*n, n-m) for m =1..n, n >= 0.
example: The rational triangle R(n, m) begins:
mathematica: T[MaxN_] := Function[{n}, With[{exp = Expand[(1/2)^(2 n) (Exp[I x] + Exp[-I x])^(2 n)]}, Prepend[ 2 Coefficient[exp, Exp[I 2 # x]] & /@ Range[1, n], exp /. {Exp[_] -> 0}]]][#] & /@ Range[0, MaxN];
T2[MaxN_] := Table[Inverse[Outer[Coefficient[#1, x, #2] &, Prepend[ChebyshevT[#, x] & /@ Range[2 MaxN], 1], Range[0, 2 MaxN]]][[n, m]], {n, 1, 2 MaxN, 2}, {m, 1, n, 2}]
program: (PARI) a(n, m) = if (m == 0, numerator((1/2^(2*n-1)) * binomial(2*n,n)/2), numerator((1/2^(2*n-1))*binomial(2*n, n-m)));
tabl(nn) = for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(a(n,k), ", ")); print()); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 19 2016
